channel.title: Brent Rathgeber
channel.description: Recent news about Brent Rathgeber, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Having not heard anything formal regarding a Porougation, I return to Ottawa on Sept. 16, the scheduled start of the Fall Sitting. #CDNpoli

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: I will have a piece published in the Sept. "Canadian Taxpayer" on the PMO and my decision to leave the CPC Caucus. #cdnpoli

item.title: Mentioned by St. Albert Gazette
item.description:
Local MP reacts to Senate scandals
When talking about the recent plague of senator expense scandals, local MP Brent Rathgeber said the events have uncovered an even bigger problem: the Prime Minister's Office's attempt at interfering with Senator Mike Duffy's expense repayment.

item.description: I blog on what to do (or not do) about the Syrian Conflict @ http://t.co/3271NWtyiO #cdnpoli

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Yesterday, I "golfed" in the Kid's Cottage Charity Tourney. Great day, raising money for North Edmonton's Children's Shelter. #yeg

item.title: Mentioned by iPolitics.ca (subscription)
item.description:
Rathgeber takes aim at PMO comms: 'I appreciate that many… were not old ...
Former Conservative MP Brent Rathgeber is continuing speak his mind, this time targeting the PMO's youthful communications wing. In his last blog post before he goes on holiday, Rathgeber – the now independent MP for Edmonton-St. Albert – continues to ...

item.title: Mentioned by St. Albert Gazette
item.description:
Local MP declares federal cabinet shuffle 'all sizzle and no steak'
Brent Rathgeber, MP for Edmonton-St. Albert, offered this analysis of Prime Minister Stephen Harper's recent cabinet shuffle: “all sizzle and no steak.” “I think it was a cosmetic change at best,” Rathgeber said of Harper's early July minister swap. The cabinet is ...

item.title: Mentioned by Ottawa Citizen (blog)
item.description:
Sunshine Listing the Canada Council
An attempt by Conservative MP Brent Rathgeber to require disclosure of public servant salaries last month triggered a rare uprising among the backbenches of the Conservative Party, after PMO heavies gutted his private member's bill at committee.
